FuncDef:
The link-protocol fr command configures an FR encapsulation type on an interface.
The undo link-protocol fr command restores the default configuration.
By default, the FR encapsulation type is IETF.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the FR encapsulation type to the IETF.
-

Sets the FR encapsulation type to the non-standard compatible format. This format is used when a Huawei device is connected to a non-Huawei device. Two devices can communicate with each other only when the FR encapsulation types on both ends are the same.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
FR supports packet switching, easy accounting, and packet transmission at a fixed rate. Before configuring an FR network, run the link-protocol fr command to configure an FR encapsulation type on an interface.
Configuration Impact
If the link-protocol fr command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
After the FR encapsulation type on an interface is changed, the system automatically deletes all the FR configurations on the interface. Therefore, you need to re-configure the interface.
